access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients use a single network-wide Authorization for Medical Record Release form shared across all five Bassett Healthcare Network facilities, with a 'Self' checkbox and 'Patient Request' purpose option to indicate self-access.

red_flags: One-year date range default may inadvertently limit scope for patients seeking older records without clear notice
bright_spots: Portal-first default delivery: records default to MyBassett Portal when no format is specified
83 fillable fields across 2 pages — exceptionally thorough digital-first design
Seven delivery format options including encrypted email with explicit risk acknowledgment
Opt-out model for sensitive records defaults toward completeness rather than requiring opt-in
Explicit no-conditioning statement protects patient rights

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with a simple web search for the parent system (Bassett Healthcare Network), though a Fox-specific search returned no results — one extra step required.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 4: Mostly digital workflow — 83-field fillable PDF can be completed entirely on-screen, but must be submitted via fax or mail rather than online form submission.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with 10 numbered sections, bold headings, and logical flow; minor issues include two typos, dense legalese in the rights section, and exposed internal file paths.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the generic authorization form for self-access via the 'Self' checkbox and 'Patient Request' purpose, but must navigate sections designed for third-party release (verbal communication auth, expiration, redisclosure warnings) that don't apply to individual access.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: No notarization or witness required, clear revocation rights, explicit no-conditioning statement; minor ambiguity in one-year date range default and no fee disclosure.

overall.summary: A.O. Fox Hospital benefits from Bassett Healthcare Network's technically excellent fillable PDF with portal-first delivery default, but the generic authorization framework — rather than a dedicated patient access pathway — keeps it from the top tier.
